Kinetic Energy: By utilizing the energy generated from body movements, such as walking or running, individuals could power small devices through wearable kinetic energy generators.

Fuel Cells: Another alternative would be to use fuel cells that convert chemical energy into electricity. These can be powered by a variety of fuels, including hydrogen, natural gas, or even biofuels.
Composting Toilets: Composting toilets can be used to generate electricity through the decomposition of organic waste. This electricity can then be used to power devices.
Geothermal Energy: Geothermal energy harnesses the heat generated beneath the earth's surface. This can be used to power devices through geothermal power plants.
Wind Energy: Wind turbines can be used to generate electricity from wind. This can be used to power devices and reduce dependence on batteries.
